TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EasingFunctionBase extends System.Windows.Freezable implements class System.Windows.Media.Animation.IEasingFunction

Docs.summary: Provides the base class for all the easing functions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can create your own custom easing functions by inheriting from this class.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a simple custom easing function. You can add your own mathematical logic for how the easing function behaves by overriding the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase.EaseInCore%2A> method.
[!code-csharp[CustomEasingFunction#CustomEasingFunction](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/customeasingfunction/csharp/customlog10easingfunction.cs#customeasingfunction)] [!code-vb[CustomEasingFunction#CustomEasingFunction](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/customeasingfunction/visualbasic/customlog10easingfunction.vb#customeasingfunction)] [!code-xaml[CustomEasingFunction#CustomEasingFunction](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/customeasingfunction/csharp/window1.xaml#customeasingfunction)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float64 Ease(float64 normalizedTime) cil managed

Docs.param: Normalized time (progress) of the animation, which is a value from 0 through 1.
Docs.summary: Transforms normalized time to control the pace of an animation.
Docs.returns: A double that represents the transformed progress.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Uses the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase.EasingMode%2A> property in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase.EaseInCore%2A> method to evaluate the easing function.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance float64 EaseInCore(float64 normalizedTime) cil managed

Docs.param: Normalized time (progress) of the animation, which is a value from 0 through 1.
Docs.summary: Provides the logic portion of the easing function that you can override to produce the mode of the custom easing function.
Docs.returns: A double that represents the transformed progress.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method transforms normalized time to control the pace of an animation for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseIn> case of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase.EasingMode%2A>.
You only have to specify your easing function for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseIn> case because the implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingFunctionBase.Ease%2A> method handles transforming `normalizedTime` for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseOut> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseInOut> cases.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the animation interpolates.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies how the animation interpolates. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *easingFunction* An object element for a class that derives from . *easingMode* The value of the enumeration that specifies how the easing function interpolates.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty EasingModeProperty
